data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3392277,"name":"Jonathan Thomas Miller","username":"Jmilly","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/a5b964/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-05-27T00:07:23.549Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eHello,\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eI was told two years ago that electronics had to be mounted to polycarb, wood, or something else non-conductive, however in the rule book I don’t see material types explicitly listed. It would be very convenient to just mount the electronics directly to the aluminum belly pan. Is this allowed/recommended?\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-05-27T00:07:23.549Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":88.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":466925,"topic_slug":"electronics-panel-material","display_username":"Jonathan Thomas Miller","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64782,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/electronics-panel-material/466925/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3392278,"name":"jedgar6","username":"jedgar6","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jedgar6/{size}/200602_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-27T00:11:30.307Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eIf we are talking about \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eFRC\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"FIRST Robotics Competition\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e, I’m not sure where you got that info. It is very much allowed. Now, do you have to be a little careful sure but it’s not banned or forbidden.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-05-27T00:11:30.307Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":68.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":466925,"topic_slug":"electronics-panel-material","display_username":"jedgar6","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":33848,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"9410"},"post_url":"/t/electronics-panel-material/466925/2","custom_user_title":"9410","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3392279,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-27T00:17:38.690Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eAs an \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003eRI\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"Robot Inspector\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e, I see electronics mounted to metal all the time.  The two things to watch out for is that the main power path from the battery to the \u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePDP\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"CTRE's Power Distribution Panel\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e/\u003cspan class=\"abbreviation\"\u003ePDH\u003ctemplate class=\"tooltiptext\" data-text=\"REV's Power Distribution Hub\"\u003e\u003c/template\u003e\u003c/span\u003e is fully insulated (\u003ca href=\"https://frctools.com/2024/rule/R607\" data-bbcode=\"true\"\u003eR607\u003c/a\u003e), and the frame is isolated from all wiring and electrical devices (\u003ca href=\"https://frctools.com/2024/rule/R611\" data-bbcode=\"true\"\u003eR611\u003c/a\u003e).  One thing to be careful of is that some electronic devices (e.g. cameras, Ethernet switches, LED strips) have metal cases that are attached to their ground line, which may require additional insulation when attaching to metal.  So look for bare metal in the wiring, and perform the \u003ca href=\"https://youtu.be/KtPGO11VGlU?t=105\"\u003eframe isolation test\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-05-27T00:19:27.890Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":258,"readers_count":257,"score":111.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":466925,"topic_slug":"electronics-panel-material","display_username":"Gavin Theres nothing with mounting to wood or polycarb just our sytle.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWith that being said it is possible to ground to your frame if you’re not careful.
